text: You know what would be a nice feature ... the ability to star pages/posts/folders that you are actively working on and it stays to the top of the list so you don't have to search for it every time. This would be completely independent for each individual users' preferences.
Rakel, why not use the Content Staging feature or a custom view?

No, I'm talking about when you go to Website Pages and it lists all the pages on your site. Being able to make certain ones sticky would be helpful, otherwise I have to search through all of our pages to find it.
Right, if you use the content staging feature, you can see only the content you are actively working on without search/filtering down.
OK, I thought maybe you were talking about something else entirely. I am noticing these tabs across the top now where one says Updated by Me
Once you create a view, is there a way to edit the name of the view or delete it?

Iâ€™m referring to Content Staging feature within Content Hub, <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/content/staging|direct link>. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|Knowledge base link>.
yes, you can rename it from the All Views screen.
OK. I don't quite need staging right now, but I will be redesigning this website in the future and this will be handy then. Thank you!
we also use it for minor changes too.
Hmm okay. I'll check it out. I just started a new job so I was mainly just doing the workflow they already have established, but maybe this is better.

Even though staging is a great functionality <@U03REFNRMB3>, I'd still vote for <@U071YF9HQF3> idea. Having a ping/star would be much more easier to work with since users (content creators) are not using staging by default.  The normal mode is to use the website pages list to make changes depending on tasks. Going to staging just adds an extra cognitive load to an already complex system.  Ping/star mental model is commonly used in other products like here on Slack or even the left bar in MacOS's Finder, though

I wish HubSpot could add this tiny feature, which would help ease the work with pages.
